intro: Indigofera brachyodon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, and its trifoliate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Indigofera brachyodon is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
